As a dedicated player of Overwatch who has loved the game for many years, I am filled with anger and disappointment towards Blizzard's recent actions in the China region. Their series of unfair decisions make me question whether they genuinely care about players' interests and the quality of the game.

Blizzard, have you forgotten the original intention of Overwatch? It was a game centered around fairness, competitiveness, and teamwork. However, recently you have repeatedly made outrageous moves in the China region, clearly to cater to specific political and commercial interests.

Firstly, let's discuss game balance. You have made some unwise adjustments to hero abilities within the game, apparently to meet the demands of certain markets. This approach not only disrupts game balance but also leaves genuine players feeling disappointed and unsatisfied. Do you not realize that game balance is the key to sustaining players' enthusiasm?

Next, let's talk about your unjust treatment of Chinese players. In some instances, you have clearly taken a political stance rather than standing with players. You are willing to forsake core values in exchange for certain political and commercial gains, and this is simply unacceptable. Your betrayal of players, your departure from the essence of the game, has left us, the once-devoted Overwatch enthusiasts, extremely angry!

What's even more infuriating is your audacity to relaunch Overwatch on the Steam platform as if nothing has happened. Do you truly believe we will forget the multitude of unfair practices you engaged in previously? This hypocritical behavior only serves to expose your true nature, your disregard and betrayal of players, leaving us deeply disheartened!

Blizzard, you were once a respected game company, but now you have left a profound stain in our hearts. Your unjust actions and insincere behavior have unveiled your real face. As players, we should have the right to enjoy a fair and friendly gaming environment, rather than becoming pawns in your political and commercial games.

Finally, I must emphasize that Blizzard, you need to reflect and confront your mistakes. Your players are not tools to be manipulated but rather the driving force behind your development. I hope you can return to the right path, re-embrace the principle of player-centricity, and regain players' respect and support. Otherwise, your Overwatch is destined to lose even more genuine players. In the end, this world doesn't need Overwatch anymore!!! Reverse the negative momentum!!! Refund us!!!
It makes you feel like an Overwatch hero

I played OW1 a whole lot in high school. I played over a thousand matches and loved the game dearly. When OW2 was announced I was really excited for the new modes and the swap to 5v5. I even played in the OW2 Beta. That said, OW2 is a steaming pile of shit. They completely deleted the original game to swap to a new F2P model. They replaced the old system with an even more predatory monetization scheme (I don't know how you get more predatory than loot boxes but here we are). Furthermore, the whole reason OW2 was created was to focus on PVE (something the first game had but could have improved upon). Instead, they completely axed PVE. OW1 underwent 3 years with no updates only to be turned into a F2P cash grab game that wastes its player's time. It is so sad to see how far this franchise has fallen.

[h3]OW1[/h3][list][*]$40 Game (Entry fee)
[*]All Heroes unlocked.
[*]Standard Cosmetics unlockable. - Get skins of your choice through free credits from gameplay.
[*]Premium Skin Store - Unlock premium skins for $20-$40
[*]Free Seasonal Events.[/list]
[h3]OW2[/h3][list][*]$0 Free Game.
[*]Heroes locked. Spend money to unlock.
[*]Standard Cosmetics locked. Buy premium currency to unlock.
[*]Premium Skin Store - Unlock premium skins for $20-$40
[*]$20 Battle-Pass with no guaranteed skins unless you grind 100 hours. You can't choose your cosmetics.
[*]$15 PVE Events.
[/list]
I installed this game on Steam to write this review. I have played Overwatch since launch and have 1,600 hours of game time. Overwatch was a breath of fresh air when it launched. It cost 40 dollars to buy-in, and you were treated with tens if not hundreds of unlockable cosmetics, and all heroes were free. You need heroes to be free because strategy in this game plays like rock paper scissors.

Overwatch 2 plays like a stripped down version of Overwatch 1. I've accepted that the past is gone. Overwatch 2's core gameplay remains fun, and you can enjoy the game without spending money. Unfortunately, every move requires money for you to do anything. Need a specific hero for a game strategy? Buy that hero. Want to try the new PVE event? Buy the dlc. Want to customize your favorite hero? Buy a battle pass and hope you grind enough hours to get the skin you want. Not enough time to grind? Buy levels for that battlepass. I play this game from time to time still but it's getting less and less now because really, I feel punished for even sticking around.

ä½ å‡ æŠŠè°å•Šï¼Ÿ
Who the fuck R U?

Now that people can finally see reviews for this game, its time to really dive into the reasons this game is no longer recommended by veterans of the game. As Blizzard has completely neglected this games casual audience and give virtually no progression beyond seeing the funny competitive symbol get shinier, I will be approaching my review from a competitive perspective.

Let me start off by saying, although this might be an unpopular opinion, the pvp 5v5 gameplay is more balanced and fun than the 6v6 gameplay was. Plenty of people have rose-tinted glasses on when remembering the first game. Everyone loves to talk about how much fun 2 tank synergies were, but nobody wants to talk about the various insane tank metas the objectively annihilated every single comp in the game. Brig might have been the WORST, most mismanaged character to ever release in a pvp shooter. It took 13 consecutive nerfs to bring her down to STILL S TIER. Role-queue was put into play simply because they could not find a way to balance GOATS, and it did make the game play better, even if they caused the very funny prank of hour long queue times (which is of course inexcusable). 2016-2017 overwatch was not good because it was perfect, it was good because it was new.

That being said, I am in no way saying that this game is recommended. The story of this game has always been 1 step forwards, 2 steps back.

Toxicity:

We remember Overwatch in 2016-2017 fondly not because it is infinitely better than the modern game. It was new back then, and unlike anything else on the market. The game had cornered this very interesting niche that was extremely fun. That being said, the cracks started to show as the player base improved. As it became more and more clear how much certain characters were objectively better than others, people started to complain. Through immense toxicity, the Overwatch community shot itself in the foot. This is an issue that worsened with time as metas became more and more polarizing. This is not an issue that is unique to Overwatch, but it is one that I personally felt was worse in Overwatch than other games like it. Not playing meta? You will be called a slur, people will start throwing your games, and leavers will plague you. 

Balance:

Blizzard man. They struggle so hard with this. Time and time again they have brought us kicking and screaming into unfun toxic metas over and over again. Double shield lasted 3 FUCKING YEARS. We had 1 good month with decent balance back in like October of 2020, only for them to randomly buff baptiste for absolutely NO REASON, bringing back a meta that ensured that game were an incredibly boring back and forth of shooting shields and nothing dying until everything did. Of course, I am talking about Overwatch 1, but what about this game? Surely it has gotten better, right?

The answer, unfortunately, is yes and no. The game is in a MUCH more balanced state in 5v5 that it ever could have been in 6v6. Metas are substantially more flexible in LADDER PLAY (OWL is NOT representative of the game we play). This being said, Blizzard has designed themselves into a hole with quite a few of the heroes in the game. Mercy when played well, is an unkillable attack helicopter that changes breakpoints on DPS characters to the point that the game entirely revolves around the 1 superhero with a pocket and their ability to kill the lobby. This is fun as the DPS, but it isnt fun for the rest of the lobby. Nobody has EVER been excited about playing into Pharmacy, Soujourn Mercy, Ashe Mercy, Widow Mercy, or any other mercy pocketed comp. And now starts the contentious and outright RAVENOUS conversation in the community. Do we fundamentally change mercy to stop this unfun and unbalanced gameplay, or do we change the characters she pockets to fix the issue?

The same issue exist in Zenyatta, which was already very good in Overwatch 1. A flat increase to the damage taken of a character vs everyone on the enemy team is insane. It was already insane before role lock, and with 2 tanks. But now that we have one, his gameplay loop is boiled down to "put the blow up ball on the big guy and everyone shoot at him."

POWER CREEP:

Oh. My. Fucking. God. The powercreep in this game. This is a problem I sense is going to continually get way worse as more and more DLC characters are released. But lets talk about the games track record with DLC characters, and how they have fundamentally DESTROYED the balance of this game.

Where most of the original Overwatch characters excel at one thing, character after launch seem to have completely thrown the idea of specialization out the window. Wrecking Ball has the best movement in the game, the most health in the game, a great zoning ult, and incredible CC and burst potential. And he STILL isnt that good currently. Want to see real power? Baptiste can out damage half the dps without interrupting his healing, DOUBLE the damage of his team with his ult, make his team immortal in a large radius with a COOLDOWN, and has an incredible vertical movement passive with NO COOLDOWN. I could go on about immortal buttons, game breaking movement, and character who do too much all day. But to summarize, where characters before excelled at movement, damage, healing, or resource denial, the new Overwatch hero design gives all of it to characters all at once, and wonders why people complain. 

A casual playerbase neglected:

Man I tried. When Overwatch 2 came out, I was promised a game that had more for the casual player. Unfortunately, they actually TOOK AWAY MORE MOTIVATION TO PLAY THIS GAME CASUALLY THAN THEY GAVE. With lootboxes and borders gone, players have to pay money for the battlepass to feel any sort of progression at all. This might be changing with hero mastery, but as of this moment I am frankly not impressed. I cannot believe I am about to say this, but Apex Legends monetization wipes the fucking floor with this game, and they only really do one thing different. There is absolutely 0 excuse to remove the leveling system and lootboxes. You can have the same level of aggressive corporate greed as everyone else, but you cannot completely deprive your casual audience of any sort of progression at all, and then expect them to stay around. I am still blown away that things like leveling and borders are gone. There is no logical reason to make that decision. 

PvE:

Nothing left to say here other than I am disappointing. There is not a single thing I can say that will make this more of a joke than it already is. Just... Wow.


I could go on and on about every little thing that I dislike about this game, but I dont feel like writing any more. This game will be studied in the industry for years. It was an internet darling. It was the only pvp shooter to ever win GOTY. It was the game people flocked to with all the interesting and charming characters. Now it is a battlepass fueled mismanaged  corporate grab bag. I cannot in good faith recommend this game to anyone, because I do not want to doom others to the cycle of disappointment those of us who held on with hope were subjected to.

Tldr: A fundamentally incredible game buried under a constantly growing pile of corporate garbage and mismanagement. You will probably love this game for some time, but the cracks begin to show early. Your time is better spent on other games.
A shell of its former self.

All the hate towards Blizzard is deserved. This is not one mistake, but a whole cascade of attempts to make money by ignoring the desires of ordinary players like us, who just want to have fun playing games. If you give money to such companies, then you will continue to support this circus, they will not have an incentive to change their attitude towards the community and gamedevelopment.
makes me say the bad words

I Put in about 3000 plus hours into this game since 2017. i became obsessed. I watched v.o.d.s, watched owl religiously, and idolized the players. Even traveled to a few events. It hurts to see what it has become. An over-monetized shit-hole from the most corrupt company in gaming. I would've been fine had it just been the shop, but aside from maps and modes, every aspect of the game is touched by monetization. (They would've had to adjust the matchmaker if they had monetized those.) The ranked experience is drastically inferior, and on release the game removed more than it added. I haven't played in months, and unless things change, wont. I really hope Microsoft's acquisition can change something, but i don't feel good about it. It breaks my heart to say, but Winston was wrong. Heroes are dead, the world didn't want ow(1), and it certainly doesn't need ow(2).

oq a Blizzard fez com esse jogo Ã© um crime.

It's just Overwatch 1 with microtransactions. The game isn't bad its just not what it used to be. They took out all of the fun free stuff and replaced it with a battle pass and a store where you can pay $20 for one skin. The core of the game is still good, but the nostalgia of what it used to be keeps it alive for me and many others. But overall, the game is pretty solid for being free; you can play 90% of the game without having to spend a dime.
